meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to one twelfth of a foot.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the board with an incher to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent2: She used an incher to mark the length of the fabric before cutting.
meanings.sent3: The tiny elf claimed he was exactly one incher tall, causing laughter among his friends.
meanings.sent4: His patience was an incher away from running out as he waited for the delayed train.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the watchmaker's work was as sharp as an incher.

meanings.sent1: The slow driver ahead was an incher, causing a long line of cars behind.

meanings.sent3: The toddler proudly declared himself the official incher of the family, moving at his own pace.
meanings.sent4: She was an incher in negotiations, slowly but steadily making progress towards her goal.
meanings.sent5: The snail was the ultimate incher, taking its time to reach the finish line.
